data.title: How to get from Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral by train?
data.meta_description: Check out the easiest and fastest way to get from Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral.
data.text:
Kuala Lumpur – General Information about Destination

Kuala Lumpur, often abbreviated as KL, is the capital and largest city of Malaysia. It is located in the western part of Peninsular Malaysia and serves as the economic, cultural, and transportation hub of the country. With a population of over 1.8 million people in the city proper and more than 7 million in the greater metropolitan area, Kuala Lumpur is a dynamic urban center with a diverse population.

The city has a rich history, dating back to its establishment as a mining settlement in the mid-19th century. It rapidly grew in importance during the colonial era when it became the administrative center for the Federated Malay States. Today, Kuala Lumpur is a modern cosmopolitan city known for its impressive skyline adorned with skyscrapers and iconic landmarks.

Information about the Route (Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral)

Travelers from Sungai Buloh have two options to reach Kuala Lumpur by train, catering to their preferences and budget.

Sungai Buloh to KL by ETS Train

Trains from Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral operate on the Southbound Train line and come in three types: Silver, Gold, and Platinum. All three classes offer a journey duration of approximately 30 minutes.

The ticket prices (harga tiket Sungai Buloh ke KL Sentral) vary slightly between the classes. For the Silver class, which is the most economical, the ticket price starts at RM10.00. The Gold class, which offers a bit more in terms of comfort, starts at RM11.00. The Platinum class, providing the highest level of service, has tickets starting at RM12.00.

Passengers have the option to purchase tickets either through the website or directly at the ticket counter at the station.

Schedule of ETS Trains

(Jadual ETS Sungai Buloh ke KL Sentral)

The train service from Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral runs 16 times a day. The earliest train departs at 7:20 in the morning, and the last train of the day leaves at 22:30 at night.

See also: How to Get from Sungai Buloh to Shah Alam by Train

Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral by KTM Komuter

Trains from Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral operate on the Tanjung Malim – Pelabuhan Klang rail line, passing through 8 stations during the journey. The travel time is approximately 40 minutes, regardless of whether it’s a weekday or weekend. Tickets for this route can be bought directly at the stations, as the KTM Komuter service does not offer the option to purchase tickets in advance.

Schedule of KTM Komuter Trains

(Jadual Komuter Sungai Buloh ke KL Sentral)

On weekdays, the train service from Sungai Buloh to KL Sentral runs 7 times a day. The first train of the day departs at 06:09 in the morning, and the last train leaves at 19:34 in the evening.

On weekends, there are 6 train services per day on this route. The earliest train departs at 07:34 in the morning, and like on weekdays, the final train of the day departs at 19:34.

Departure point – Sungai Buloh Station

The Sungai Buloh station is an integrated railway station located in the suburb of Sungai Buloh, Selangor. Situated to the northwest of Kuala Lumpur, the station boasts a strategic location near Jalan Kuala Selangor and Jalan Sungai Buloh, as well as Jalan Hospital. It serves as an interchange station connecting the KTM Komuter Port Klang Line, KTM ETS services, and the MRT Putrajaya Line.

The station features a total of six tracks and three platforms, with four tracks and two platforms dedicated to KTM services, while the remaining two tracks and one platform serve the MRT. Its common elevated concourse serves as a central hub for ticketing, featuring ticket vending machines, ticketing offices, and retail outlets for the convenience of travelers. The station also offers essential facilities including surau (prayer room), toilets, and kiosks. Additionally, a parking lot for over 1000 cars and a nearby bus stop for feeder buses further enhance accessibility for commuters.

See also: How to get from Seremban to KL Sentral KTM by train?

Arrival Point: KL

There are two main options for traveling from Sungai Buloh to Kuala Lumpur.

KL Sentral

KL Sentral, located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, serves as a central transportation hub offering various transportation options such as trains, buses, taxis, and light rail transit (LRT). Situated in the Brickfields area, it is conveniently positioned about 3 km from the city center. Its strategic positioning enables convenient access to different parts of the city as well as intercity and international destinations.

The station is organized into various sections to accommodate different rail services. For the ETS, passengers can proceed to Level Two of the Transit Concourse, where they can purchase ETS tickets at the ticket counters and await their train departure in the waiting area. KTM Komuter ticket counters and ticketing machines can be found on both sides of Level 1 in the main concourse of KL Sentral. The KTM Komuter trains are conveniently situated on Level 1 of the Transit Concourse, ensuring a seamless transition for travelers.

Kuala Lumpur Station

Located on Jalan Sultan Hishamuddin, Kuala Lumpur Station serves as the secondary departure point for travelers journeying from Sungai Buloh to Kuala Lumpur. This historic station is renowned for its colonial-style architecture, which originated in the early 1900s, attracting visitors as a notable tourist attraction.

The station primarily caters to KTM Intercity trains, providing a cost-effective alternative for travelers compared to the high-speed ETS trains. Alongside ticket counters and waiting areas, Kuala Lumpur Station offers a range of amenities, including food outlets, a parking lot, and a convenience store.

About ETS

The Electric Train Service (ETS) is a high-speed intercity train service in Malaysia, operated by Keretapi Tanah Melayu (KTM). It provides convenient connections between major cities like Kuala Lumpur, Ipoh, and Butterworth.

ETS trains are equipped with modern amenities to enhance passenger comfort, including air conditioning, spacious seating, and onboard toilets. To cater to diverse preferences and budgets, the ETS offers different train classes such as Gold, Platinum, and Silver, each providing varying levels of comfort and pricing.

About KTM Komuter

KTM Komuter is a popular commuter rail service operated by Keretapi Tanah Melayu Berhad (KTMB) in the Klang Valley region of Malaysia. It serves as a reliable transportation option for residents and visitors, connecting key areas such as Kuala Lumpur, Petaling Jaya, and surrounding suburbs. All KTM Komuter trains are air-conditioned and offer comfortable seating for passengers.
